website_summaries.verdict: An affordable option for repelling deer and rabbits without harming plants. All-natural, long-lasting repellent is guaranteed to work or your money back.
pros: simply hang pouches near problem areas
cons: You will get the best results from the pouches if you find a way to secure them
some reports of them being knocked down/carried away by animals

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be helping!
customer_reviews.text: We have a lot of deer in the neighborhood, and they eat pretty much anything. We have tried sprays, netting, and other things to keep them away from our plants but don't always have success. Deer are not supposed to like hydrangea and yet we have been unable to keep them away from one that was taken from my grandmother's property before it was sold. They had eaten it back pretty hard, but I have placed one of these pouches near the plant, and it seems to be coming back. We also placed one near a rose bush that they have been eating, and it was able to bloom without them eating the flower right away. I hope this continues!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: I put these out last year after deer ate most of my new tomato plants down to nubs. I got more plants and hung these on the cages. had no issues after that. just ordered them again since the garden is going in this weekend. I tied them to the tomato cages. they smelled strong of pine. maybe a bit like soap. but are some type of plastic block that did not melt away. at the end of the season I cut them off and threw them out. by then [may-October] there was no scent left in them.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Gomez

customer_reviews.title: The product probably warrants 5 stars as to its presentation ...
customer_reviews.text: The product probably warrants 5 stars as to its presentation and intended usefulness. I give it 4 because deer have eaten hostas and bushes despite the fact that the sachets have been placed strategically properly. The larger reality is that a hungry deer will eat without regard for the presence of soap, human hair, predator urine, flashing lights, or sachets of various kinds. Crossbows are the next line of defense. I'm sorry to add that our two resident wild rabbits seem to roam freely about, too.
customer_reviews.author: David Gooding

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy anything from these guys!
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn’t work at all! We hung more then the recommended amount in our small planter and still the deer are often walking right up and eating our plants to death. Worse, we tried for weeks to get a hold of someone in customer service from the seller to try and find a solution and they kept saying someone would call us back, but no one ever does. They have the worst customer service, don’t care at all about their customer or their product. Don’t bother with any item from these guys, save your time, money, and frustration.
customer_reviews.author: MCB

customer_reviews.title: Best smelling, didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Smell great, but don’t deter deer! Especially if you’re overrun with babies and/or have idiot neighbors feeding the deer corn, you’re screwed. Look up plants deer won’t touch like lantana, vinca, marigolds, and zinnias. This was my last ditch effort after trying sprays, granular, some dried blood stakes, human hair, even human urine! The knock out roses are done. If you want to grow deer candy like tulips, pansies, petunias, or hostas, forget it. Buy a 12 foot fence.
customer_reviews.author: vtkaty13

customer_reviews.title: Only deterred deer when I hung 6 of them in a 4' area
customer_reviews.text: I tried about 5 different sort of deer deterrents this season. This product did deter the deer from eating cucumbers on a net, but only when I hung 6 of them in a very small area - they then didn't eat the vines in that area but they ate right up to it. As a perimeter deterrent they didn't work for us at all. Physically the product is well made, easy to deploy and generally is as promised. There was no discernible reduction in the size of the bars after an entire season out.
customer_reviews.author: EbbyTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: It's Just Soap on a Rope
customer_reviews.text: Basically, this product is just soap on a rope with an expensive price tag. Upon opening the box, the strong smell of soap is definite. Having said that, I'd already discovered that deer do not like the smell of Irish Spring soap. Save yourself some money and just go buy some Irish Spring soap, cut the bars in strips/wedges and place around your plants/garden area.
customer_reviews.author: rainykel

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work!
customer_reviews.text: I used a similar product last year and it worked great to keep my flowers safe from the deer that visit my garden. This is a different brand. I hope it will be just as effective. I want to wait until my tulips are up a little more before I start to use it. The repellent is very easy to use. Just tie the little bag of repellent to a tree branch. Unfortunately this one didn't work. At least 4 deer are visiting nightly in spite of the repellent. My tulips are munched on and they are also browsing on shrubs.
customer_reviews.author: Curious lady

customer_reviews.title: We may have smart deers, too smart for this
customer_reviews.text: It is did the job for about a week. Now the deers are back eating the plants and even pulling out the bags. Find two on the drive way.... We may have smart deers, too smart for this product
customer_reviews.author: Guy Pochard/Gabriele Wittenburg

customer_reviews.title: They work.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one bag two weeks ago, they are working, no damage to my trees or burning bush. I have them hung on anything that I think the deer will prey upon. I recommend them,,, bought my second bag and hung these up as well. Try them, for me, they are saving my landscaping.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mang

customer_reviews.title: Sure sounded like a good solution-we'll see.
customer_reviews.text: These things have a pleasant smell. Not sure if they'll work to deter deer and rabbits who are gobbling my wife's flowers. BUT you need to space them every 3 feet and at a level near the deer's head. They are harder to spec than I had imagined. Also the packaging is a resealable bag with the tear strip. I couldn't tear the strip off. Even after I cut it off, I couldn't open the zipper. Still if they work as well as advertised, they will have been worth it.
customer_reviews.author: JBPIS

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me!
customer_reviews.text: So it seems like people have different results with this product. It seems to have worked for me. I had tulips that were sprouting earlier in the spring and I quickly put these babies out. Hung them on a Shepard's hook and along the fence. Works on the little plastic sign holders that my lawn maintenance crew use to post their "Stay out of yard" signs once its safe again. What I didn't like was that if they fell onto the ground, the did melt and actually dissolved the mesh bags the were in.
customer_reviews.author: shornsby

customer_reviews.title: Deer Repel Deer Repelllent Pouches do NOT Stop Deer
customer_reviews.text: Despite having multiple just purchased pouches hanging in the large hydrangea bush in my front yard, one deer was able to eat most of the blossoms on the bush-I came home recently and watched as the deer calmly stood by my front door-eating the white blossoms one by one. The bush now has nice leaves and green sticks where the blossoms used to be-very disappointing. I think the only effective deer deterrent is a canine. Maybe 4 blossoms are left.
customer_reviews.author: C. Thierry

customer_reviews.title: Actually works
customer_reviews.text: I have bought many many deer/rabbit products and most don't work. I would have given it 5 stars but the deer attacked a few pots I had with this product in it ( I do think deer are impossible to repel 100% though). Worked great with rabbits if that is your only foe. They kept eating my black eyed susans before they had a chance to come in- I placed these in the area and they actually grew. I will be buying more for the winter to pace around my bushes which the deer are very fond of
customer_reviews.author: mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: It's working
customer_reviews.text: I put all ten pouches out around my center island on garden stakes. Strangely, 4 of them disappeared. Did a deer drag them off? I bought another batch and more green metal stakes. The deer have stayed away from my roses and have stopped bothering annuals they had started eating to the ground. It smell just like Irish Spring soap in a bag (and maybe it is) but it WORKS!
customer_reviews.author: Maggiez

customer_reviews.title: Might as well hang out the dollar bills on sticks in bags
customer_reviews.text: This stuff doesn't work. I think it must be based off of the old wives tail that soap deters deer. The idea is great. Its in a nice little pouch, it smells good, and its easy to handle. Of course if your doing to hang up something that smells good you could do potpourri pouches! But thats not what I was looking for obviously. I have purchased two liquids (Bobbex and Deer Out) and they actually work! We have HEAVY deer traffic. So I would definitely not recommend these pouches of worthless matter.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: THIS ISTHE BEST PRODUCT EVER.
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing. I live in a senior community and we have hundreds of deer. I’ve tried everything before I found this and nothing worked. Now I have lots for flowers in pots and on the ground and there fine, no deer or rabbits eats them. They won’t even come on my property, which is wonderful I tell everyone how great it is , so they can buy it too. But I have a question for you, why did you change the name? It was called deer no no.
customer_reviews.author: Blanche Pollard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: So far last summer was the best deer repellent we had in our yard where deer is abundant.
customer_reviews.author: D. S.

customer_reviews.title: I wanted these to work.....
customer_reviews.text: And maybe they do on "country" deer. If your deer are like ours, live in the burbs with zero Fs to give.... my only surprise is they didn't actually eat the block. Yes they are placed at 3ft intervals, I have 20 of them out..... On a plus, the yard smelt nice for a few days LOL
customer_reviews.author: donkey

customer_reviews.title: product' effectivness
customer_reviews.text: Used the same products last year with excellent results. I have 3000 sq foot flower garden inside the fence and another 80 sq feet outside the fence. In 2018 it was common to see 2 to 3 rabbits inside the fence and the same amount of deer outside the fence. When I used the product last year I had zero rabbits in the garden with no deer eating the garden outside the fence. I care for a second garden on museum grounds in the middle of farm land and had the same positive results. I would highly recommend the products. Caveat -- when using the clips don't forget to follow the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Tobaygo

customer_reviews.title: These didn't work brilliantly for me
customer_reviews.text: These didn't work brilliantly for me. But I have a special kind of evil deer at my house which aren't afraid of, or repelled by, anything.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Petersen

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I put the deer repellant bags down about a week ago and have not seen any further signs of missing vegetation. Hopefully your bags are doing the trick. The only suggestion I could give you would be to include some stakes with the bags. That would save 1 trip to a big box store to purchase them.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: May or maynot work
customer_reviews.text: The product seems to work on some plants but doesn't on some others but that is not 100% so I am perplexed about the results. I do think it is worth while trying because the deer were eating my Laurels after hanging a bag in the bush they continued eating for a few days and then quit so you can see my dilemma.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Driver

customer_reviews.title: Little trouble with Deer
customer_reviews.text: The current set is the second one we have had. We had minimal problem, but not no problem, with something nibbling on the vegetable plants. We have no way to no if there was cause and effect. A set is good for 12 months. We have not had the new set very long. So far no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Homer E. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much doesn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: I hung 4-5 of these around plants in a 15' x 7' area in the backyard where we have deer frequently traveling through. I hung them low (1ft off the ground) and high (4-7 ft off the ground). Sure, the deer won't eat the product but I have watched them eat the plants in this space just like any other day. I won't be buying this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: avoid this product
customer_reviews.text: This product boasts being effective for 12 months, but within 2 months, it had no effect on the deer in my yard. This was even after I replenished some units, hanging several just a few inches away from each other (staggering the freshness so that there were "new" units applied straight from the package every few weeks). So while it might be a deterrent at first, it does not keep deer from eating trees or plants within close range (about 6 inches from the soap-smelling item). Cheaper options are available with far better results. I will not buy this product again. It was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus M

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for the new apple trees I planted as the deer were very fond of their delicious new leaves. The price was worth it, these little bags certainly did the trick. The apple trees recovered nicely and the scent is similar to a heavy soap so its not obnoxious to humans. Would highly recommend this product . Its far better than having to spay a deer repellent after every rain storm. You simply hand the scented bag and walk away.
customer_reviews.author: June C. Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Helped...not stopping totally
customer_reviews.text: I have hung 2 of the repellents per young tree to start. I will order 1 more and put a total of 4 on each young tree. It has not seemed to stop them totally from nibbling on some branches. I will try one more time with extra order before I can give final judgement call.
customer_reviews.author: smoothie

customer_reviews.title: Nice to see
customer_reviews.text: The deer were feasting on my Knock Out Roses. Followed directions and hung the bags at bloom strength and my blooms make it through the night. Nice to see. Don't know how long these last as it has only been three weeks since I hung the up but so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy D

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work at all. The darn rabbits still ate me lillies that were right next to these pouches.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be getting the job done. We had ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be getting the job done. We had new plantings around our new home. We put plastic 4ft green plastic plant stakes near each new planting and tied one of these on top. The nibbling stopped. We'll see how long they last but so far it's been 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for us.
customer_reviews.text: We have a problem with 3 to 6 deer visiting our yard every few days and leaving a significant amount of droppings. I bought this product and followed the instructions on where to hang the 10 scented pods, around the yard. No deer for about five days, then they returned. One deer was even eating dead grass just below a pod on a tree!
customer_reviews.author: HOWARD

customer_reviews.title: Missing in Action
customer_reviews.text: I hung 5 bags on a tree that the deer have been eating and those seem to be working as new leaves are coming in and are untouched. The other 5 bags I placed lower and tied them to some rose bushes - those are gone. Completely gone. Bag. Soap. Everything. What animal would steal bags of soap??? They didn't last 2 weeks!
customer_reviews.author: Niere

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I was astonished to see that deer had been devouring my rose bushes, my hydrangea blooms, my hosta and even my green tomatoes! After much research, I decided on these deer repellents. I have not had any further damage since hanging these little satchels in my garden! I only wish I had done it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: The deer would be in my garden right next to the repellent just chomping away. Wish they had worked.
customer_reviews.author: Christa L

customer_reviews.title: I heard Irish spring soap is the same.  I think it might be.  Smells the same.
customer_reviews.text: First time deer approached repellent hanging from bird feeder he sniffed around and then walked away not far. Turned around and this time stayed. I currently have 7 either hanging from feeder or branches around feeder and one in empty birth bath. They don’t work. Deer emptied one whole feeder.
customer_reviews.author: diane

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The raspberries were being eaten by deer so decided to try Deer Repel. The product arrived very quickly. The pouches were very easy to tie onto the support wires for the raspberries. Need more time to see if Deer Repel really works.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Schopp

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Have A Lasting Affect
customer_reviews.text: Kept the deer away for about a week now they are back eating my flowers. Added a 2nd one to each location and seemed to keep them away again for another week. These are not as long lasting as advertised. From now on I will only buy deer resistant plants.
customer_reviews.author: Les

customer_reviews.title: I think these attract deer!
customer_reviews.text: They do not work well at all. I hung three in the vicinity of my rose bushes, but deer still stripped bushes clean. See no practical use for them. A waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Discenza

customer_reviews.title: Simply the BEST Deer Repellent!!
customer_reviews.text: We live in an area with protected deer roaming throughout our neighborhood. Of all the products I have used, this is the best. It is very effective. I will keep using this product and will order again.
customer_reviews.author: Bill, San Jose

customer_reviews.title: just like we do
customer_reviews.text: ummmmmmmmm..... it may have helped, but I was away all winter, and, well - lots of things got eaten in the late winter - they get very hungry, just like we do......
customer_reviews.author: S.Lemler

customer_reviews.title: It definitely works!
customer_reviews.text: I live in rural area w/ a ton of deer. Other products I've used have worked, but if it rains, you start over. This doesn't smell to me and placing these as instructed completely stopped the deer. I mean 100%
customer_reviews.author: Mark D. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Deer Repellent
customer_reviews.text: We have put up the bags but it is too early to tell if they are going to keep our deer away. They have only been up for four days so that is not long enough--so far it is working.
customer_reviews.author: V. L. B

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother buying this product.
customer_reviews.text: I put these out all around the perimeter of small yard and the next day my garden looked like the buffet at all you can eat joint after six tour buses stopped for lunch. The deer ate all the buds off my echinacea that were 6 inches away from a pouch. I had another pouch by a Hosta plant that was half eaten and there were deer droppings right in front of a third pouch as if they were laughing at me. Seriously, this was a huge waste of money! Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Guenther

customer_reviews.title: Best Deer resistant product ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried SO many products and THIS IS THE ONLY ONE THAT DISTRACTS DEER!!! What a great way to keep your plants alive, and make deer just turn and walk away!!! WOW!!! It’s a WIN WIN!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra P

customer_reviews.title: satchels are nice, but.....
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product and disregarded the negative reviews. The deer in my neighborhood must have been both amused and annoyed by my efforts, as they literally CHEWED THROUGH the satchels and STOMPED ON the Irish Spring imitators. Didn't help that my husband did the "I told you so" and it was a waste of money, time and effort. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: mbenerin

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for my hungry deer.
customer_reviews.text: Description is accurate and item is as described. I just must have hungry deer. This has not prevented them from eating all my plants and and trees. 12 of them to be exact as I heard them stomping around and counted. May work, but has not worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bross

customer_reviews.title: It works!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent safe product and it works!!! Finally something that truly repels deer!
customer_reviews.author: Donfescue

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: works but heavy for hanging on plants like hosta they love
customer_reviews.author: Jan Lyon

customer_reviews.title: They seem to really work,
customer_reviews.text: They seem to really work, the Deer have left our flowers along
customer_reviews.author: James Rohrborn

customer_reviews.title: Kept the deers away.Un
customer_reviews.text: Until we found the deer repel the deer's were eating all our flowers and shrubs. Now we have beautiful flowers and the deer 's stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Any green growth is coming out on the deers favorite bush.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and was as described. They appear to be working. New. Any green growth is coming out on the deers favorite bush.
customer_reviews.author: GORDON E. SOMMERS

customer_reviews.title: All well in the garden !
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with over all product and service...Have not noticed any further sign of plant damage.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bredbenner

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the deer from my roses.
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the critters off my roses. Imagine my distress this spring when I found my roses first blooms eaten by our local deer herd. So I hung guest from 2' stakes, surrounding the roses, and have had o problems since.
customer_reviews.author: Chicken Jim

customer_reviews.title: The deer didn't care
customer_reviews.text: 4 around 3 close rose bushes did not stop the deer from eating the new growth. Worth a try, maybe good for someone else, maybe twice as many would work.
customer_reviews.author: Bede

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy!
customer_reviews.text: This was the easiest way to repel deer from my flowers. Just hang them and done! I've used Deer Scram in the past, but it had to be reapplied periodically and was more expensive. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: quietcows

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work for "My Pet" Deer
customer_reviews.text: I put this product right in front of the plants I was trying to protect. The deer ignored the pouches and ate all they wanted in my garden. The smell is like Irish Spring soap, which I used years ago that also didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: The deer repellent pouches worked like a charm to protect my brand new daylillies! After one or more deer ate all of the new blooms of my daylillies, I order the pouches and installed them right away. For the rest of the season the pouches worked and not another deer has bothered my flowers since! Will reorder in the Spring. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Carey Ker

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: After following the directions on the package, I am sad to report that the deer ate my “deer resistant “ plants in the large pots in front of my house. All nine pots have been on the deer buffet. Save your money and look for some other way to keep the deer away.
customer_reviews.author: JodieInMaryland

customer_reviews.title: you need a lot of them to cover all your plants from deer
customer_reviews.text: to repel deer, however, they already ate all my hosta, so will buy more next spring and start the battle all over again
customer_reviews.author: lynda nemeth

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I put them out on Saturday. Today is Monday. . So far so good. Haven’t seen them gnawing on my hostas. I would send this review out to customers after 2-3 weeks of receiving it. Then I could tell you if they are staying away from the plants consistently even though they still come to our yard.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product!!!!
customer_reviews.text: they absolutely work!! my deer eaten flowers have all grown back and I don't have to mess with sprays or chemicals,
customer_reviews.author: Patty Anne

customer_reviews.title: Really Keeps the Deer Away!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to keep the deer from eating our young apple trees. These are the only things that we have found to work! Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Deer Repellent
customer_reviews.text: Have only had in place a week but so far the deer are staying away. Am going to put them in other locations since they seem to be doing the job. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara J Sandheinrich

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I purchased. Each time from different advertisers. They don't work even after hanging more than one on plants. Deer still ate leaves and flowers.
customer_reviews.author: JBF

customer_reviews.title: Work for me
customer_reviews.text: This works for me. The deer love to rub and eat my small trees, after putting this on there, significantly less damage.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Effective to keep deer away..so far
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product! So far the deer have stayed away and the product actually has s somewhat pleasant smell. Good packaging and easy to hang in your garden and not at all unsightly. I am ordering more!
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: the longer they hang the braver the deer are getting especially the fawns
customer_reviews.author: Axxxmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This works for my gardens.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time for me to order this product....... I ordered only because this deer repellant was effective
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Cranmer

customer_reviews.title: does it work
customer_reviews.text: I put up 6 pouches on my bird feeder pole the rest I put on the ground.i now have one with a deer footprint in it.it didn't work at all.deer ate around them,just moved them with their noses.
customer_reviews.author: melanie cruger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.  Great deer repellent
customer_reviews.text: These work great. I planted several new apple trees and wanted to keep the deer away. I have a trail camera set up and can see the deer avoiding the new trees because of these pouches. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The real test will be when our Ash Tree is full of new leaves (we live in the mountains so our growing season/no snow is short lived), but for 2 weeks now...new growth and no munched leaves!
customer_reviews.author: DSchonewald

customer_reviews.title: all seemed great, followed clear directions exactly
customer_reviews.text: Prompt delivery of product, all seemed great, followed clear directions exactly. I think our deer are very hungry here as I noticed fresh deer tracks and evidence of new grazing this morning. I really want this product to be the answer.
customer_reviews.author: Miss s J Lugg

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be keeping the deer away
customer_reviews.text: We have not had deer in our garden after using Predator Guard. Perhaps this is just good luck.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: DIdn't keep the deer away from my trees
customer_reviews.text: Had these tied on multiple trees. The deer were eating the trees only a week later. Despite the claims that this product "will last for months".
customer_reviews.author: Doy Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really work .
customer_reviews.text: The deer will eat all the new growth ABOVE where you placed the repellent pouches. You will need 4 pouches for every plant.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P.

customer_reviews.title: Deer repllent
customer_reviews.text: I hung this repellent on all of our Cottonwood trees. So far, the damned deer haven't been bothering them ( as usual ), We'll see if the repellent keeps working.
customer_reviews.author: Junior

customer_reviews.title: NO EVIDENCE THAT DEER REPEL STOPS DEER FROM EATING OUR PLANTS!
customer_reviews.text: DEER REPEL "may" have stopped rabbits from eating our day lilies, but the deer charged right in and ate ALL of the blooms. As far as I'm concerned, there's absolutely no evidence that DEER REPEL works as advertised. Perhaps the deer who inhabit our area are much hungrier than in other parts of the country, but hungry or not, they were NOT deterred by DEER REPEL.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Deer walked right by while grazing in my garden. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: DonnieJ

customer_reviews.title: Blah
customer_reviews.text: Eh, seems to work somewhat OK. But, you need to place them 3 feet apart. On my property, I would need about a Zillion
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Todd

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Not as much of a deterrent as expected. This product did not work at all. The deer are still eating all of my plants.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: They really work
customer_reviews.text: We have a summer place in the woods. I love flowers, especially hanging baskets. Usually, deer ;make a salad of my flowers and hosta. I hung a couple on each basket. My flowers are beautiful! They leave them alone. They do not like the smell. It smells like soap. I plan on keeping the pouches and putting Irish spring in them and use them again.
customer_reviews.author: pat ramey

customer_reviews.title: High Hope
customer_reviews.text: After reading the previous reviews, I had high hope for this product. Unfortunately, the deer were not affected. They walked right in the middle of the garden and ate the tops off of several lilies, even with a bar hanging right next to them. We had better success with garlic powder and onion powder.
customer_reviews.author: d.bennett

customer_reviews.title: Lunch is served
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 units of product that cost over $100. Seems rabbits love the this stuff, have it around my pool and the perimeter of the garden but the bunnies come right up to the pools screen and have dinner. Dogs can’t get to them and they know it. Drives my dogs crazy
customer_reviews.author: pissed

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work - returned
customer_reviews.text: We were hopeful this would work but didn't stop the deer from eating everything in sight
customer_reviews.author: Wayne E Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Irish spring soap in bags
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty sure this is Irish spring soap in bags... could have done that myself!
customer_reviews.author: HH

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would try this but about I was a bit skeptical. I'm very pleasantly surprised that all of the many critters we see in our yard have left the garden alone. Lettuce, broccoli, everything is doing extremely well. I'm now a believer and will surely use it again.
customer_reviews.author: VSanfelipo

customer_reviews.title: not sure if it works
customer_reviews.text: I think it might have helped our landscape to ward off deer. But i recommended to our friends. It was a disaster for them. Place packets 12 inches apart in front of evergreens. First night deer ate the side off the evergreens. That is the reason for 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen W.

customer_reviews.title: Product does not work on deer
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work, I used it to try and keep deer away from our orchard and bird feeders, we have pictures from the cameras showing this product not affecting the deer at all, this has happened on two different occasions. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy G.

customer_reviews.title: It works! A lot of flowers were bitten and ...
customer_reviews.text: It works! A lot of flowers were bitten and as soon as I hung the pouches, the plants started growin again.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona

customer_reviews.title: no staisfied
customer_reviews.text: This does not keep deer away. The deer still eat bushes, bird seed out of feeders and grass roots in yard
customer_reviews.author: Matt N.

customer_reviews.title: seems to working so far
customer_reviews.text: the deer population has stopped chewing on my plants in the area. Let's hope it continues to work.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Bye, Bye Deer
customer_reviews.text: I have not seen a deer in my yard since I hung these pouches. I put them in the ornamental trees and on stakes in the garden. I see them across the street but not in my yard. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: tel

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 2 weeks then deer ate all of our tomatoes.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This product has truly worked to stop the deer from treating my flower garden as their buffet.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca M Hinely

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good not perfect but let’s behonest unless you have a 6-7’ fence your not gonna keep every single deer away I have them on peach trees and cherry trees most of the deer walk right past them or hangout under the trees without standing up and eating the trees
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: I put these pouches on my plants. I checked ...
customer_reviews.text: I put these pouches on my plants. I checked them and the pouches had been bitten off by the deer. I guess they ate them. I put new pouches on, and now those are gone as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works to keep deer away. Scent is pleasant and strong. Will buy again for next spring.
customer_reviews.text: I like the "soap bar" shape and included pouches. Does work. We have deer and woods around us. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These work!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install & they keep the deer from eating all the bushes _& flowers.
customer_reviews.author: SWiles

customer_reviews.title: It didn't repel the critters I wanted it to.
customer_reviews.text: I assumed it is deer that is cleaning out the squirrel-busting bird feeders. I hung a bag on opposite sides of the feeder and the feeder was empty the next morning.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

product_meta.title: Deer Repel Deer Repellent Plants Pouches Stop Deer Rabbits Eating Plants Trees Gardens
feature_bullets: ★ POWERFUL DEER & RABBIT REPELLENT THAT WORKS! - Long lasting formula protects your plants, flowers, trees and vegetables from deer and rabbit invasion
★ READY TO USE, 10 PACK - Simply hang or stake repellent pouches near plants or trees you want protected. Create a perimeter around your garden
★ RAIN RESISTANT, SUPER LONG-LASTING - Deer Repel Repellent Pouches protect your garden day and night
★ ALL NATURAL INGREDIENTS, PLEASANT SPICE SCENT - No Harmful Chemicals or Poisons - No Foul Odors! - Made in USA
★ 100% MONEY BACK GUARANTEE - Join thousands of homeowners, gardeners, professional landscapers and commercial growers who swear by our deer and rabbit repellent’s effective results and fresh scent
